sen.j: 名家（めいけ、めいか）とは、鎌倉時代以降に成立した公家の家格のひとつで、羽林家と同列で、半家 (公家)の上の序列に位置する。
sen.e: Meike (also pronounced Meika) was one of kakaku (family status) of kuge (court noble) established after the Kamakura period and it was of equal rank as the House of Urin and positioned in the upper rank than hanke (a kind of family status of the Court nobles) (kuge.)

Meike (also pronounced Meika) was one of the kakaku (family status) of kuge (court noble) established after the Kamakura period and it was of equal rank to the House of Urin and positioned in a higher rank than hanke (a kind of family status of the Court nobles) (kuge.)

Meike (also pronounced Meika) was one of the kakaku (family status) of kuge (court noble) established after the Kamakura period and it was of equal rank to the House of Urin and positioned in a higher rank than hanke (a kind of family status of the Court nobles) (kuge).
sen.cmt: 文末ピリオドの位置修正

sen.j: 大納言を極官とするのは羽林家と同じである。
sen.e: It was same as the House of Urin in that Dainagon (chief councilor of state) was kyokkan (the most highest rank which one was appointed.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was same as the House of Urin in that Dainagon (chief councilor of state) was kyokkan (the highest rank one could be appointed.)
It was same as the House of Urin in that Dainagon (chief councilor of state) was kyokkan (the highest rank one could be appointed).
sen.cmt: 文末ピリオドの位置修正

sen.j: しかし、羽林家が近衛府等の武官職系を経て大納言に進むのに対し、侍従・弁官（蔵人・蔵人頭を兼任）等の文官・事務系職を経て中納言・大納言に進む。
sen.e: However, in the case of the House of Urin, one was promoted to Dainagon after the posts of military officers such as Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), while in the case of Meike, one was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) and Dainagon after the posts of civil officers and administrative officers such as jiju (a chamberlain) and benkan (a controller of the Oversight Department) (also served as kurodo (chamberlain) and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) at the same time.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the case of the House of Urin, one was promoted to Dainagon after the posts of military officers such as Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), while in the case of Meike, one was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) and Dainagon after the posts of civil officers and administrative officers such as jiju (a chamberlain) and benkan (a controller of the Oversight Department) (also served as kurodo (chamberlain) and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) at the same time.)

However, in the case of the House of Urin, one was promoted to Dainagon after the posts of military officers such as Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), while in the case of Meike, one was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) and Dainagon after the posts of civil officers and administrative officers such as jiju (a chamberlain) and benkan (a controller of the Oversight Department) (also served as kurodo (chamberlain) and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) at the same time).
sen.cmt: 文末ピリオドの位置修正

sen.j: 例外として日野家は左大臣、柳原家は准大臣、烏丸家と万里小路家は内大臣に進んだ者もある。
sen.e: As an exception, there were some people who were promoted to Sadaijin (Minister of the left) in the Hino family, Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) in the Yanagihara family, Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) in the Karasumaru family and the Madenokoji family.

As an exception, there were some people who were promoted to Sadaijin (Minister of the left) in the Hino family, Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) in the Yanagihara family, Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) in the Karasumaru family and the Madenokoji family.

As an exception, there were some people who were promoted to Sadaijin (Minister of the left) in the Hino family, Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) in the Yanagihara family, Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) in the Karasumaru family and the Madenokoji family.

sen.j: また、日野流は侍従を初任とするが勧修寺流は衛門府を初任とする場合が多い。
sen.e: In addition, in most cases, the starting rank was jiju in the Hino line while it was Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) in the Kajuji line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, in most cases, the starting rank was jiju in the Hino line while it was Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) in the Kajuji line.
In addition, in most cases, the starting rank was jiju in the Hino line while it was Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) in the Kajuji line.

sen.j: 新家の場合には弁官のみで蔵人を兼ねず、途中で四府佐や八省輔を経た後に参議に任ぜられる家がある。
sen.e: In the case of new families, one was appointed to benkan and he didn't served as kurodo at the same time, and depending on families, one was appointed to Sangi (councillor) after the posts of Shifunosuke (left and right divisions of the Inner and the Middle Palace Guards) and senior and junior assistants of Hassho (eight ministries and agencies) in the middle of his career.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「～参議に任ぜられる家があるなど、家によって昇進に差がある～」は、「～参議に任ぜられる家がある。」「このように、家によって昇進に差がある～」と分割しました。
sen.e: In the case of new families, one was appointed to benkan and he didn't served as kurodo at the same time, and depending on families, one was appointed to Sangi (councillor) after the posts of Shifunosuke (left and right divisions of the Inner and the Middle Palace Guards) and senior and junior assistants of Hassho (eight ministries and agencies) in the middle of his career.

In the case of new families, one was appointed to benkan and he didn't served as kurodo at the same time, and depending on families, one was appointed to Sangi (councillor) after the posts of Shifunosuke (left and right divisions of the Inner and the Middle Palace Guards) and senior and junior assistants of Hassho (eight ministries and agencies) in the middle of his career.

sen.j: このように、家によって昇進に差がある場合がある。
sen.e: Thus, families could have a difference in promotion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thus, families could have a difference in promotion.
Thus, families could have a difference in promotion.

sen.j: 幕末時で名家は30家弱を数えるが、その大部分は日野流藤原氏および観修寺流藤原氏の諸家。
sen.e: At the end of Edo period, there were a little less than 30 Meike and most of them were families of the Hino line of the Fujiwara clan and the Kajuji line of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 「観修寺流」は、正しくは「勧修寺流」であると思われます。
sen.e: At the end of Edo period, there were a little less than thirty Meike and most of them were families of the Hino line of the Fujiwara clan and the Kajuji line of the Fujiwara clan.
At the end of Edo period, there were a little less than thirty Meike and most of them were families of the Hino line of the Fujiwara clan and the Kajuji line of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 中でも、日野家、広橋家、烏丸家、柳原家、竹屋家、裏松家、甘露寺家、葉室家、勧修寺家（かじゅうじけ）、万里小路家（までのこうじけ）、清閑寺家、中御門家、坊城家は、十三名家と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Above all, the Hino family, the Hirohashi family, the Karasumaru family, the Yanagihara family, the Takeya family, the Uramatsu family, the Kanroji family, the Hamuro family, the Kajuji family, the Madenokoji family, the Seikanji family, the Nakanomikado family, the Bojo family were called thirteen important noble families.

Above all, the Hino family, the Hirohashi family, the Karasumaru family, the Yanagihara family, the Takeya family, the Uramatsu family, the Kanroji family, the Hamuro family, the Kajuji family, the Madenokoji family, the Seikanji family, the Nakanomikado family, the Bojo family were called thirteen important noble families.

Above all, the Hino family, the Hirohashi family, the Karasumaru family, the Yanagihara family, the Takeya family, the Uramatsu family, the Kanroji family, the Hamuro family, the Kajuji family, the Madenokoji family, the Seikanji family, the Nakanomikado family, the Bojo family were called thirteen important noble families.

sen.j: その子堤輝長より堤と改める。
sen.e: The family name was changed to Tsutsumi when the family head was Terunaga TSUTSUMI who was a child of Sadanaga NAKAGAWA.
sen.cmt: 「その子」は「中川貞長の子」と解釈して訳出しました。
sen.e: The family name was changed to Tsutsumi when the family head was Terunaga TSUTSUMI, the child of Sadanaga NAKAGAWA.
The family name was changed to Tsutsumi when the family head was Terunaga TSUTSUMI, the child of Sadanaga NAKAGAWA.

sen.j: 西洞院時慶の子平松時庸が祖。
